description: This file defines the ApiClient class, a minimal fetch-based HTTP client with pluggable authentication token support. It provides generic methods for various HTTP verbs (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE), handles JSON parsing and error surfacing, and manages authorization headers. It also includes a factory function for creating a singleton-like API client with dynamic token retrieval.

classes.name: ApiClient
classes.description: A minimal HTTP client for making API requests with support for authentication tokens and JSON handling.

methods.name: constructor({ getToken, baseUrlOverride } = {})
methods.description: Initializes an ApiClient instance with optional token getter and URL override.

methods.name: _log(...args)
methods.description: Logs messages to the console if the log level is set to 'debug'.

methods.name: request(method, path, { headers = {}, body, asJson = true, signal } = {})
methods.description: Performs an HTTP request with specified method, path, headers, body, and options; handles JSON parsing and error reporting.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Performs a GET request to the specified path.

methods.name: post
methods.description: Performs a POST request with the given body.

methods.name: put
methods.description: Performs a PUT request with the given body.

methods.name: patch
methods.description: Performs a PATCH request with the given body.

ctags.name: request
ctags.pattern: /^  async request(method, path, { headers = {}, body, asJson = true, signal } = {}) {$/
ctags.signature: (method, path, { headers = {}, body, asJson = true, signal } = {})
